intro: Eriocaulon inyangense, commonly known as the Inyang sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in moist or wet habitats, such as marshes or along the edges of water bodies. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and colonize new areas. Eriocaulon inyangense is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in parts of Africa and Southeast Asia.
